intro: Ecbolium trifolioides, commonly known as the three-leafed thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a woolly texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Ecbolium trifolioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
